intro: Hibbertia virgata var. crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It typically grows in heathlands and dry sclerophyll forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. This variant is distinguished by its broader, more robust leaves compared to other forms of Hibbertia virgata.
